alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 2:26AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern Santa Barbara County. * WHEN...Until 415 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rainfall across the Santa Barbara area early this morning. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inch per hour have been observed with the band of rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Barbara, Montecito, Carpinteria, Isla Vista, Summerland, Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park, Goleta, Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass, and Mission Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
